body:
Comment 15: 
There's a quick hack which could be made to fix the removal problem,
specifically, which is starting a new iteration in the last removed
hash, and allowing the iteration to wrap over.

But this is not ideal.  The concept of popping things out of a
hash map like is being done is inherently flawed.  It's
hand-picking hashes on one end of the bucket one by one,
and thus killing the basic balance property of a hash map.

It'd be nice to fix the problem in a way that avoids the more
fundamental problem, rather than just working on the edge case.
